30 30

Celebrating 30 Years of AIDS Vancouver

The 30 30 Campaign was created in 2013 to celebrate AIDS Vancouverâ€™s 30th anniversary. The campaign pieces together the dynamic history of HIV in Vancouver, told by and for those who where there.

1984

1985

Our Cherry Grove

In 1985

  • The wreck of the 1912 RMS Titanic is discovered in the North Atlantic. LINK
  • DNA is first used in a criminal court case. LINK
  • Gorbachev takes over USSR. LINK

Local

  • On October 7, 1985 BCCDC offered the first HIV tests. Daphne Spencer was the only nurse administering the tests. LINK
  • Vancouver commemorates the friends and family who died of AIDS, in a Cherry Tree Memorial Grove planted at Stanley Park. LINK
  • AIDS Vancouver opens its first office location at 1033 Davie.
  • AIDS Vancouver's posture campaign is launched, which urged at-risk people to get tested and refrain from donating blood.
  • First municipal and national funding provided to AIDS Vancouver.
  • AIDS Vancouver announced its first Executive Director, Bob Tivey.

Statistics

  • 63 Reported AIDS Cases in BC. LINK
  • 648 cumulative cases of AIDS diagnosed in Canada since 1979. LINK
  • 51 countries report at least one AIDS case, one on every continent except Antarctica. LINK

Global

  • Mechai Viravaidya, 'The Condom King' in Thailand started a safer sex campaign, drastically reducing new infections. LINK
  • Cleve Jones creates the first panel of the AIDS Memorial Quilt. LINK
  • Actor Rock Hudson dies - The first public figure to openly admit to dying of AIDS. LINK
  • amfAR, The Foundation for AIDS Research is founded in New York. LINK
  • HIV+ hemophilic teenager Ryan White is banned from school. LINK

National

  • On May 9, the Canadian Red Cross acknowledged that AIDS can be found in blood. On Nov. 4, they begin testing the blood supply for HIV. LINK
  • The first Canadian Conference on AIDS was held in Montreal. LINK
  • Ontario AIDS Network created. LINK
1986

AIDS Vancouver - Prevent. Act. Support.
Celebrating 30 Years of AIDS Vancouver
  • 30th Anniversary RSVP
  • Donate
  • Acknowledgements

AIDS Vancouver plays a special role in providing quality health care to people affected by HIV/AIDS living in the Lower Mainland. It is clearly more than just a community health care organization. It is an organization whose presence and continued strength is essential to the quality for life of this community and of each individual and family who draws on its services.

Our Agency is a vital community asset which everyone affected by HIV/AIDS can share, and in which we all have a stake.

Visit us at aidsvancouver.org

2013 © AIDS Vancouver
